alert.note: Alert for Bear Lake Valley; Blackfoot Mountains; Caribou Range (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 13 at 7:55AM MST until January 14 at 2:00PM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THIS MORNING... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 2 PM MST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches, except 6 to 10 inches on ridge tops and elevations above passes. * WHERE...St. Charles, Montpelier, Georgetown, Wayan, and Swan Valley. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until 11 AM MST this morning. For the Winter Storm Warning, from 5 PM this afternoon to 2 PM MST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Bear Lake Valley; Blackfoot Mountains; Caribou Range
